author: David Petesch
title: Two newcomers to join the St. Charles D303 school board
text:
An even split of newcomers and incumbents were elected to the
St. Charles School District 303 board.
With all ballots counted, results show incumbents Heidi Fairgrieve and Kate Bell, as well as newcomers Kimberly Rich and
Jenna Hancock winning in the race for school board
Eight candidates were competing for four seats on the school board, and as of April 15, Fairgrieve, Bell, Rich and Hancock each have more than 15% of the vote.
Thomas Lentz was the only incumbent candidate not reelected to the school board.
Lentz was the next highest vote getter, coming within 1,000 votes of the top four, followed by newcomers Elias Palacios, Antonietta Berton-Nicklaus and Aaron White, in descending order by votes.
Results will be officially finalized on April 22 once final canvassing is completed.

author: Newsroom Infobae
title: Vaticano restituye a priora de EEUU acusada por obispo de mantener relaciones con un cura y consumir drogas - Infobae
text:
El Dicasterio para los Institutos de Vida Consagrada y Sociedades de Vida Apost√≥lica ha restituido a la priora del convento de las carmelitas de Arlington, en el estado de Texas (Estados Unidos), que hab√≠a sido acusada de tener relaciones √≠ntimas con un cura, consumo de drogas y desobediencia contumaz por el obispo de su di√≥cesis Fort Worth, Michael Olson.

 En un decreto firmado el 30 de abril por este dicasterio y hecho p√∫blico por el medio 'Life Site News', el Vaticano ha revocado la expulsi√≥n de la madre Agnes decretada por el obispo en junio de 2020.

 El pasado 16 de mayo el propio obispo revel√≥ que hab√≠a recibido un informe en abril de 2023 sobre que la madre Teresa hab√≠a "cometido pecados contra el Sexto Mandamiento y violado su voto de castidad con un sacerdote de fuera de la Di√≥cesis de Fort Worth".

 Un d√≠a despu√©s de ser nombrado Comisario Pontificio, el 1 de junio, Olson expuls√≥ a la madre Teresa de la orden carmelita, declarando que su investigaci√≥n de seis semanas la hab√≠a considerado culpable de mantener relaciones √≠ntimas con un sacerdote. Se le concedieron 30 d√≠as para apelar la decisi√≥n ante el Vaticano. Tras su apelaci√≥n, el Vaticano ha decido restituirla al frente del convento.

Ëµ∑ÊêèÂô®‰ºöÈÖçÂêà‰∏Ä‰∏™Ë¥¥Âú®ÁöÆËÇ§‰∏äÁöÑÊó†Á∫øÁöÆËÇ§ÁïåÈù¢‰∏ÄËµ∑Â∑•‰Ωú„ÄÇËøô‰∏™ÁöÆËÇ§Ë¥¥ÁâáÊîØÊåÅÂøÉÁîµÂõæÊï∞ÊçÆÊî∂ÈõÜ„ÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆÂàÜÊûêÂíåËøëÁ∫¢Â§ñËåÉÂõ¥ÁºñÁ®ãÂÖâÂèëÂ∞ÑÔºåÂàÜÊûêÂà§Êñ≠ÊòØÂê¶ÊúâÂøÉÂæãÂ§±Â∏∏„ÄÇÂèëÁé∞ÂøÉÂæãÂ§±Â∏∏ÂêéÔºåÁöÆËÇ§ËÆæÂ§á‰ºöÂèëÂá∫ËøëÁ∫¢Â§ñÂÖâÔºåÂÆûÁé∞Ëá™‰∏ªÈó≠ÁéØÂøÉËÑèÁîµÁñó„ÄÇ
ÁΩóÊù∞ÊñØËØ¥Ôºö‚ÄúËøô‰∏™Á≥ªÁªüÂáèÂ∞ë‰∫ÜÈ£éÈô©ÔºåÊ∂àÈô§‰∫Ü‰º†ÁªüÊúâÁ∫ø‰∏¥Êó∂Ëµ∑ÊêèËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°àÁöÑÁπÅÁêêÊÄß„ÄÇ‚Äù‰º†ÁªüËµ∑ÊêèÂô®ÈúÄË¶ÅÂØºÁ∫øÁ©øËøáÁöÆËÇ§ËøûÊé•Â§ñÈÉ®ÁîµÊ∫êÔºåÊÇ£ËÄÖÊ¥ªÂä®ÂèóÈôê‰∏îÊúâÊÑüÊüìÈ£éÈô©ÔºåËÄåËøôÊ¨æË£ÖÁΩÆÂÆåÂÖ®ÂÜÖÁΩÆÔºå‰æùÈù†‰ΩìÊ∂≤‰æõÁîµÂíåÂÖâÊéßÔºåÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÊÇ£ËÄÖÊëÜËÑ±ÊùüÁºö„ÄÇ
‰∫∫‰ΩìÂÜÖÂèØÂÆåÂÖ®Âê∏Êî∂

author: Afp
title: Mayotte en alerte rouge et barricad√© √† l'approche du cyclone Chido
text:
"On a tr√®s peur": les habitants de Mayotte se pr√©parent au passage de Chido, un cyclone tropical intense qui s'appr√™te √† balayer t√¥t samedi matin l'archipel de l'oc√©an Indien, plac√© en alerte rouge.
"L'heure est grave. Mayotte n'a jamais connu une telle situation", a d√©clar√© dans la journ√©e de vendredi le pr√©sident du conseil d√©partemental, Ben Issa Ousseni.
Au milieu de la nuit, heure locale, le cyclone se trouvait √† environ 140 km au nord-est de Mayotte selon le dernier bulletin de M√©t√©o-France. Il devrait effleurer "en fin de nuit" Mayotte et y d√©cha√Æner des "vents destructeurs voire d√©vastateurs".
L'alerte rouge est entr√©e en vigueur √† 22H00 (20H00 √† Paris) sur l'archipel.
Dans son bulletin, M√©t√©o-France souligne que Chido a subi "une l√©g√®re baisse d'intensit√© ces derni√®res heures" mais qu'il devrait se maintenir √† une "intensit√© significative" au cours des "prochaines 36 heures".
"J'ai fait le plein de bouteilles d'eau, de nourriture, de bougies...", t√©moigne aupr√®s de l'AFP Fatima, habitante de Majicavo-Koropa et m√®re de trois enfants, qui craint les "vents violents" et les "orages".
"On a tr√®s peur", confie cette femme de 57 ans, encore marqu√©e par le passage d'un cyclone quand elle √©tait enfant aux Comores voisines, se souvenant des "vagues (qui) ravageaient tout" et des "poteaux √©lectriques par terre".
En fin de nuit de vendredi √† samedi, M√©t√©o-France pr√©voit √† Mayotte "des pluies tr√®s intenses et des submersions marines possibles", des conditions m√©t√©orologiques qui entra√Ænent "un risque de ruissellement et d'inondation, et une houle marine qui peut avoir des effets importants sur le littoral", a pr√©cis√© le pr√©fet de Mayotte, Fran√ßois-Xavier Bieuville.
Des oiseaux volent au-dessus du port √† Mamoudzou, sur l'√Æle fran√ßaise de Mayotte, le 19 f√©vrier 2024
JULIEN DE ROSA - AFP/Archives
"C'est un √©v√©nement in√©dit, d'une extr√™me violence, les vents pourront d√©passer 180 km/h", a-t-il soulign√© lors d'une conf√©rence de presse.
Concomitamment de l'alerte rouge, la circulation a √©t√© interdite sur la voie publique des deux √Æles, Grande-Terre et Petite-Terre, et l'a√©roport de Dzaoudzi a ferm√© depuis 20H00 (18H00 √† Paris).
L'Agence r√©gionale de sant√© (ARS) demande aux patients de "ne pas se d√©placer mais d'appeler le 15", et ajoute que "les moyens m√©dicaux ont √©t√© renforc√©s pour prendre en charge les personnes bless√©es ou malades".
M√©t√©o-France souligne qu'"une am√©lioration est attendue √† partir de samedi en fin de journ√©e".
- Nombreuses habitations pr√©caires -
La pr√©fecture locale, elle, a demand√© sur le r√©seau social X √† la population de rester "confin√©e dans une habitation solide, avec √† disposition un stock adapt√© d'eau et de nourriture".
A ceux qui vivent dans des habitations pr√©caires, tr√®s nombreuses dans le d√©partement le plus pauvre de France, le pr√©fet a conseill√© de rejoindre l'un des 71 centres d'h√©bergement "ouverts √† tous" dans des √©tablissements scolaires et des gymnases.
Sont concern√©es en priorit√© les quelque 100.000 personnes logeant dans des "habitations non solides" qui ont √©t√© identifi√©es par les autorit√©s, sur une population totale estim√©e √† 320.000 habitants dans l'archipel.
Si elle vit aujourd'hui dans un "logement s√©curis√©", Fatima reste tout de m√™me inqui√®te: "On va √©couter la radio et faire tout ce qu'il faut".
Outre la diffusion d'une alerte SMS par les autorit√©s, "les policiers municipaux sont all√©s dans chaque village", a indiqu√© le pr√©fet, notamment dans les quartiers difficiles d'acc√®s.
"La priorit√© c'est de mettre les gens en s√©curit√©", assure le maire de Chiconi, Madi Ousseni Mohamadi, qui pr√©pare le coll√®ge de sa commune - ferm√© vendredi et samedi comme tous les √©tablissements scolaires de l'archipel - √† accueillir la population.
Le maire de cette commune qui borde le littoral a aussi d√©ploy√© des agents pour "d√©gager les abords des routes des √©l√©ments qui pourraient s'envoler et faire des d√©g√¢ts", comme des carcasses de voitures.
Le ministre de l'Int√©rieur d√©missionnaire Bruno Retailleau a particip√© √† un point de situation au centre op√©rationnel de gestion interminist√©rielle des crises √† Paris, confirmant l'envoi √† Mayotte de 110 professionnels de la s√©curit√© civile depuis l'√Æle de La R√©union.
"Je demande √† la population de respecter les consignes des autorit√©s", a-t-il indiqu√© sur X.
L'archipel de Mayotte, relativement √©pargn√© par les cyclones, avait √©t√© touch√© par le cyclone Belna en 2019, sans d√©g√¢t majeur.
Aux Comores voisines, une alerte cyclonique de niveau orange a √©t√© activ√©e. La direction g√©n√©rale de la s√©curit√© civile a ordonn√© la fermeture des a√©roports √† partir de vendredi 18H00 locales (15H00 GMT) "en raison des conditions m√©t√©orologiques extr√™mes".
A Madagascar, l'≈ìil du cyclone s'est approch√© √† une centaine de kilom√®tres du nord de l'√Æle et a caus√© une pluie "abondante l'apr√®s-midi" ainsi qu'un "vent fort" avant de s'en √©loigner, selon les autorit√©s.
"Plusieurs quartiers sont inond√©s" mais "le plus dur semble √™tre derri√®re nous", a d√©clar√© √† l'AFP Cerveau Rakotoson, un habitant d'Antsiranana, principale ville du nord de l'√Æle.
dje-mli-clv-sha/bfa/rr/lpa
Par J√©romine DOUX / Saint-Denis de la R√©union (AFP) / ¬© 2024 AFP

author: @KTVU
title: Novato city workers hail 3-day strike as successful, back on the job Friday
text:
Novato city workers hail 3-day strike as successful, back on the job Friday
NOVATO, Calif. - City workers in Novato went back to work Friday after a three-day strike that union leaders hailed as a success in their ongoing contract negotiations with the city.
Back on the job
What we know:
Members of Service Employees International Union Local 1021 and city leaders also returned to the bargaining table Thursday and the two sides are scheduled to continue working on a labor agreement next Wednesday, city officials announced Friday.
The union represents maintenance workers, building inspectors, parks and recreation coordinators, city planners and office assistants.
In addition to SEIU Local1021, the Novato Police Managers Association and Police Officers Association are also in contract talks with the city.
Agreement reached
City officials said that they reached an agreement last month with the Novato Police Civilian Employees Association, which includes dispatchers and community service officers, along with three other unrepresented employee groups that improves pay and benefits for 31 percent of city staff.
"With the same offer extended to SEIU employees, the approved agreements provide 11 percent salary increases over three years and up to an additional 13 percent equity adjustments to move positions closer to market median," city officials said in a news release Friday. "The city continues to cover 100 percent medical benefits for employees and their families, offer a flexible work schedule and provide eight additional weeks of paid parental leave."
Strength of the union
Union officials said the strike helped them gain leverage in their talks with the city.
"By going on strike, we made a strong impact, and the city was forced to respond. We were successful in getting them back to the table," said union spokesperson Ian Lee. "While SEIU 1021 membership has decided to return to work in good faith, it is our hope that the city will bargain in good faith. The union retains its right to engage in lawful concerted activity in the future."
Even though the strike is over, some Novato Parks & Recreation camps and programs won't resume, including gymnastics classes on Saturday, Camp Ton-of-Fun, Camp Ton-of-Fun Minis, Counselor In Training, and Gymnastics Full and Half Day Camp are closed through the final week of the season that ends Aug. 15.
For questions related to Parks & Recreation programs, people can contact novatofun@novato.org.
Featured

organizations.name: Novato Police Managers Association and Police Officers Association

author: Zayna Allen
title: Jennifer Lopez Ex-Husband Says She Was Involved In Diddy ‚ÄòFreak Offs‚Äô
text:
Jennifer Lopez‚Äôs first husband, Ojani Noa, has sparked controversy by claiming she attended Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs‚Äô notorious ‚Äú freak-off‚Äù parties during their relationship. Noa made the allegations through a now-viral Instagram post, distancing himself from the parties while implicating Lopez, his ex-wife.
‚ÄúI‚ÄôM NOT ON THE LIST,‚Äù Noa emphasized in his post. He added, ‚ÄúTo those people and media outlets asking if I ever went or participated in that Piece of Sh*t (DIDDY‚ÄôS) Freak-Off Parties. No and No. Never. But my Ex-Wife (Jennifer Lopez) a.k.a (JLO) Did‚Ä¶ Ask Her.‚Äù He also urged people to question Lopez about alleged explicit recordings, writing, ‚ÄúOh, and ask her about the SEX TAPES‚Ä¶‚Äù
Noa‚Äôs comments come as Combs faces multiple lawsuits related to sexual misconduct and accusations that his infamous parties involved numerous high-profile celebrities.
Ojani Noa Speaks Out In an interview with Univision‚Äôs Despierta Am√©rica , Noa expanded on his Instagram post. ‚ÄúFirst of all, I‚Äôm not accusing anyone, let‚Äôs clear the air,‚Äù he said, clarifying that he simply wanted people to stop asking him about his involvement in Combs‚Äô events. Noa also stressed that while he was never part of the parties, he believes Lopez was present. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt go to any party, but she did go to the parties,‚Äù he added.
Noa and Lopez were married in 1997 but divorced within a year. He partly blames their split on her relationship with Combs, whom she began dating while working on her debut album, On the 6 . ‚ÄúWhen Diddy got involved, that‚Äôs where the separation began,‚Äù Noa stated. He revealed that while Lopez‚Äôs career was taking off, he felt their relationship was deteriorating due to her increasing professional and personal closeness with Combs.
Jennifer Lopez Silence Lopez has not publicly responded to Noa‚Äôs claims. The singer and actress, now married to actor Ben Affleck, has been known to guard her personal life carefully. Meanwhile, Noa continues to express his frustration over the fallout from their brief marriage. ‚ÄúTo tell the truth, to talk about everything that happened in the past,‚Äù he said, would be his request if they ever met again.

author: winter cozy jazz cabin
title: Comment on The War on Christmas! by winter cozy jazz cabin
text:
Ah yes, it‚Äôs that most wonderful time of the year. You know, that time of the year where the politically correct right demand the use of the phrase ‚ÄúMerry Christmas‚Äù versus the clamor of the politically correct left who stipulates the use of the more inclusive phrase ‚ÄúHappy Holidays‚Äù.
This argument has come to light once more not simply because of the holiday season, but in part due to President Donald Trump proclaiming that, ‚ÄúWe Are Going to Say ‚ÄòMerry Christmas‚Äô Again‚Äù.
Of course, the PC-right based primarily in social conservatism lauded proclamations, as this was surely a sign that America was going to become an unashamedly ‚ÄúChristian Nation once more‚Äù, while those in the alt-right viewed Trump‚Äôs statement as another slap in the face to the poison that is their much reviled, ‚Äúpolitical correctness‚Äù.
And unsurprisingly, those on the PC-left decried Trump‚Äôs ‚Äú
Merry Christmas USA Thank You Tour 2016‚Äù as Trump ‚Äúweaponizing‚Äù the phrase ‚ÄúMerry Christmas‚Äù as a ‚Äúpartisan slogan for a president elected on a wave of hateful rhetoric about, among others, refugees‚Äù. Their response to Trump and the PC-right‚Äôs Howitzer-phrasing that is ‚ÄúMerry Christmas‚Äù is but of course, the response with the evermore ‚Äúinclusive‚Äù phrase, ‚ÄúHappy Holidays.
‚ÄúI say Happy Holidays because I have a deep respect for all religions‚Äù,
said Cecilia Lewis, who self-admittedly has been ‚Äúworking very hard to recover from the choice to elect someone completely unqualified to hold the Presidency‚Äù, but would like to mention that ‚Äúthere is no war on Christmas and no war on Christians‚Äù, as she has ‚Äúbeen wished Merry Christmas as if it were a verbal weapon‚Äù.
*Sips eggnog*
Alrighty, folks. It‚Äôs time to lay down some truths‚Ä¶
With this entire ‚ÄúHappy Holidays vs. Merry Christmas‚Äù debate‚Ä¶
I. Don‚Äôt. Care.
And honestly, neither should you.
As the son of a pastor, I grew up in a social conservative, rural, and predominately Christian area. The ‚ÄúWar on Christmas‚Äù was always something I had heard about on the likes of Fox News while growing up, but nothing that really ever impacted me. After all, I was surrounded by those who were like-minded and never really gave much thought to the whole Merry Christmas vs. Happy Holidays debate, as it didn‚Äôt pertain to me.
Upon going to college, I was immersed in a socially diverse group of students on campus. Christians, Atheists, Muslims, Jews, Buddhists, Hindus, Agnostics, etc‚Ä¶ And yet while there were a few socially progressive students on campus who were more than happy to pick up the banner of ‚Äúsocial justice‚Äù in their call for an implementation of a ‚ÄúHappy Holidays campus‚Äù, the vast majority of students on campus, of whom were from a diverse mix of religions and cultures, really didn‚Äôt see it as a problem that needed correcting.
See, here‚Äôs the thing; when it comes to ‚ÄúMerry Christmas vs. Happy Holidays‚Äù, most people simply don‚Äôt care. In a poll conducted by the
Morning Consult, most people couldn‚Äôt care less whether you say ‚ÄúMerry Christmas‚Äù or ‚ÄúHappy Holidays‚Äù. Honestly, the only people who seem to find offense in either phrase are those who grace the politically correct mantles of both the left and the right.
Yup, you read that right. Political Correctness is found on both sides of the political spectrum.
On the left, we often find the PC nature to be as inclusive as possible, going so far to deem anything outside the realm of ‚Äúinclusiveness‚Äù as being somehow offensive and narrow-minded.
On the right, the PC culture stems from the distancing from traditional values (or as they often like to cite as Christian values), which are then found to be considered offensive to said traditionalists, making ‚ÄúHappy Holidays‚Äù a direct assault on their Christian/traditionalist values.
But when it‚Äôs all said and done, these politically correct fringes on both the left and the right are a minority in our society. Again, go back to the Morning Consult poll. People simply don‚Äôt care. And seriously, neither should you.
If you find yourself reading this article and identifying yourself in either my ‚ÄúPC-left‚Äù or ‚ÄúPC-right‚Äù categories, I ask you to take a step back and truly ask yourself, ‚ÄúDoes it really even matter?‚Äù
If you‚Äôre in the PC-left, those who wish you a ‚ÄúMerry Christmas‚Äù don‚Äôt hate you. They don‚Äôt hate other religions. They aren‚Äôt out to offend. They‚Äôre wishing you well this holiday season.
If you‚Äôre in the PC-right. those who wish you a ‚ÄúHappy Holidays‚Äù don‚Äôt hate Christmas. They aren‚Äôt trying to start a nuclear war on Christmas or Christianity. They aren‚Äôt some pansy social justice warrior looking to cause a fuss. They‚Äôre wishing you well this holiday season.
The holiday season is a time to reflect on our blessings, to come together with family and loved ones, and to appreciate one another despite the differences we may have. It‚Äôs not a time engage in sensational rhetoric that promotes self-righteous arguments about whether people should say ‚ÄúHappy Holidays or Merry Christmas‚Äù.
So please, next time you‚Äôre about to start a debate over ‚ÄúHappy Holidays vs. Merry Christmas‚Äù- DON‚ÄôT.
Stop. Take a deep breath. Enjoy the fact that someone went out of their way to wish you well this holiday season, regardless of how they phrased it.
And with that, Season‚Äôs Greetings, Merry Christmas, Happy Hanukkah, Happy Festivus, Joyous Kwanzaa, and to everyone else, Happy Holidays.
Listen to Brian‚Äôs latest episode of The Brian Nichols Show on the We Are Libertarians Network
